alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Scattered strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, Currituck, and central Chowan Counties and the southeastern City of Virginia Beach through 630 PM EDT... At 524 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chapanoke, or near Elizabeth City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy downpours producing rainfall totals of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Hertford, Winfall, Elizabeth City State University, Grandy, Weeksville, Chapanoke, Snug Harbor, Nixonton, Shiloh, Belvidere, Rockyhock, Indiantown, Morgans Corner, Corolla, Burgess and Old Trap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
